alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 11:56AM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. Runoff from earlier rains will continue to cause minor flooding. Flooding has been observed along many portions of Highway 190 and is also possible along Highways 127 and 178. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction, Panamint Springs, Homewood Canyon-Valley Wells, Darwin and Tecopa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
